summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from July 2019 regarding procurement issues (specifically purchase orders ANIXTER TP120240 & SIGNET TECH TP120150) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It involves BOP staff discussing signature approvals and vendor credit applications. The document is marked as sensitive and property of the U.S. Department of Justice.

persons.name: Shawn Campbell
persons.context: Appears in an email from July 16, 2019, discussing the status of a signature approval for a procurement memo.

persons.name: Roxann Garcia
persons.context: Appears in an email from July 16, 2019, instructing 'Mr.' to follow up with another 'Mr.' on a procurement matter.

persons.name: Luis Diaz
persons.context: Appears in an email from April 1, 2019, informing 'Ms.' about a delay in receiving fiber cable for camera systems and vendor documentation requirements.

persons.name: Al Cutler
persons.context: An external vendor account manager providing instructions for setting up a credit account with Anixter, including contact information.

events.title: PO Processed in UFMS
events.description: The purchase order for Signet Tech (TP120150) was processed in the UFMS system.

events.title: Delay in Camera System Installation Reported
events.description: Luis Diaz reports that the installation of camera systems is delayed because the required fiber cable has not been received from the vendor, who is requesting documentation.

events.title: Email Chain on Signature Approval
events.description: A series of emails among BOP staff discussing the need for a correctly signed modification memo for purchase orders ANIXTER TP120240 and SIGNET TECH TP120150.

events.title: Memo Signed and Forwarded
events.description: An email states that a memo has been signed and is attached, asking if a new memo will be required.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional CTR, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
US Department of Justice MCC-New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007-1704
keyFacts: The correspondence involves procurement for the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, specifically for items like fiber cable and camera systems.
There is a noted delay in a project due to the vendor (Anixter) requiring credit application documentation before releasing fiber cable.
The document is marked as sensitive U.S. Department of Justice property, with warnings against unauthorized disclosure.
Multiple BOP staff members (Shawn Campbell, Roxann Garcia, Luis Diaz) are involved in resolving signature and procedural issues for purchase orders.
The email chain spans from April to July 2019, highlighting ongoing administrative hurdles in the procurement process.
